intro: Lomaria lherminieri var. exaltata, commonly known as the tall lomaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens for its delicate foliage and airy floral display.
